metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1304 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
object-observe.js in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before45.0.2454.101, does not properly restrict method calls on access-checkedobjects, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy viaa (1) observe or (2) getNotifier call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '45.0.2454.101-0ubuntu1.1201').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
